featured.text: Many people who are troubled by skin rashes caused by bug bites use “foggers,” or “bug bombs,” to get rid of the annoying crawlers in their homes.
Moreover, bugs that do come in contact with the mist may be resistant to the pesticide.
Many people think these bug killers or pesticides will penetrate every place where the insects hide.
It’s easy to see why anyone would call this insect a bad-looking bug.
First of all, the gases used in bug bombs are highly flammable and thus pose a serious risk of fire or explosion if the product is not used properly.

other.text: Foggers, or bug bombs, should really be a measure of last resort.
When you use a bug bomb, a chemical mixture rains down on your counters, furniture, floors, and walls, leaving behind oily and toxic substances.
Second, once a bug bomb is used, every surface in your home will be covered with the toxic pesticide.

definition.en_def: An insect; a flaw or error in a system or program.
definition.example: I found a bug in the software that needs to be fixed.
